alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:21PM EST until January 09 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Davidson County in central North Carolina... Eastern Forsyth County in central North Carolina... Guilford County in central North Carolina... Randolph County in central North Carolina... * Until 700 PM EST. * At 521 PM EST, thunderstorms producing heavy rain have caused significant flooding in Davidson County, Randolph and Guilford Counties. Buffalo Creek is out of its banks in Greensboro and many of creeks around the area will continue be flooded this evening. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greensboro, High Point, Asheboro, Lexington, Randleman, North Carolina Zoo, Badin Lake, Thomasville, Kernersville, Seagrove, McLeansville, Archdale, Summerfield, Trinity, Gibsonville, Stokesdale, Pleasant Garden, Jamestown, Liberty and Ramseur. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
